intro: Tessiera lanigera, commonly known as the woolly tessiera, is a species of flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
